These hill stations near Shimla define natural beauty in all its forms. Blessed with beautiful landscapes, and dotted with mighty snow-clad hills, meandering rivers and tiny hamlets, these stunning hill stations near Shima make for a perfect vacation for all occasions and purposes. Some of these hill stations are hidden gems known only to localities so if you are looking for quiet and peaceful vaca amidst the hills, head out to Kangojodi, Jibhi, Shoja etc. while there is also no dearth of mainstream tourist places like Manali, Kullu, Chail, Solan etc. These picture perfect, quaint and charming hill stations near Shimla are equally loved by romantic couples, families, honeymooners, wanderers, adventure enthusiasts and photography buffs, if not more! Here is the list of 35 Hill Stations near Shimla for an Extended Vacation 1. Kufri, Himachal Pradesh 4.0 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Himalayan Nature Park (Kufri Zoo) Skiing in Kufri Mahasu Peak Kufri, nestled in the heart of Himachal Pradesh, is renowned for its picturesque landscapes and outdoor activities, especially skiing during winters. Its Himalayan Nature Park and the opportunity to interact with the region's unique fauna are major attractions for tourists. How to Reach from Shimla: Kufri is approximately 13 km away from Shimla. You can easily reach by taking a local bus, hiring a taxi, or driving, with the journey taking about 30-40 minutes through the winding mountain roads. Distance from Shimla: 14 km Best Time: November to March 12 Kufri Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Fagu, Himachal Pradesh - Serene hill station near Shimla Fagu, perched amid the verdant apple orchards and terraced fields, is celebrated for its breathtaking vistas of the snow-capped Himalayas and enchanting trekking trails. This charming hamlet also serves as a base for various orchards and offers a serene retreat for nature enthusiasts.How to Reach from Shimla: Fagu is approximately 20 km away from Shimla. One can easily get there by hiring a taxi or using local buses, with the journey typically taking about an hour through scenic mountain routes. Distance from Shimla: 18 km Read More 3. Theog, Shimla - Of the less crowded hill stations near Shimla 3.8 /5 View 5+ photos Theog, nestled amidst dense forests and terraced fields, is a lesser-explored gem in the Shimla district, offering captivating views of the Himalayan ranges. It serves as an ideal destination for those seeking tranquillity and a break from crowded tourist spots.How to Reach from Shimla: Theog is situated about 32 km away from Shimla. The journey can be completed in around an hour and a half by taxi or local buses that frequently ply on this route. Distance from Shimla: 28 km Read More 4. Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh - Cozy little hill-station near Shimla 4.2 /5 View 22+ photos Known For : Monkey Point Toy Train Ride Timber Trail Kasauli, a quaint hill station in Himachal Pradesh, boasts of colonial-era architecture and dense forests, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. The serene ambiance, combined with the allure of nature, makes it a sought-after retreat for travelers.How to Reach from Shimla: Kasauli is approximately 75 km away from Shimla. It can be reached in about 2-2.5 hours by car or taxi, traveling via the NH5 and Major District Road. Shoghi, Himachal Pradesh - Offbeat hill station near Shimla 4.6 /5 View 7+ photos Known For : Kandaghat Trekking in Shoghi Tara Devi Temple Shoghi, a lesser-known gem near Shimla, is adorned with verdant forests and numerous ancient temples, offering a tranquil escape from the bustling tourist spots. Its natural beauty and pleasant climate make it an ideal destination for relaxation and rejuvenation.How to Reach from Shimla: Shoghi is located just 13 km away from Shimla. Shoja, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Waterfall Point Jalori Pass Serolsar Lake Shoja, nestled in the Seraj Valley, is a pristine and untouched destination offering breathtaking panoramas of the Great Himalayan National Park. Its tranquility, combined with stunning views of snow-clad peaks and dense forests, provides a serene getaway for nature enthusiasts.How to Reach from Shimla: Shoja is approximately 110 km away from Shimla. The journey takes about 4-5 hours by car or taxi, passing through Kullu and the Jalori Pass, making the journey as captivating as the destination itself. Distance from Shimla: 57 km Best Time: April to June 5 Shojha Attractions Read More 7. Chail, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Chail wildlife sanctuary Camping Kali Temple, Chail Chail, a quiet hill station in Himachal Pradesh, boasts the world's highest cricket ground and offers splendid vistas of the surrounding mountains, making it a peaceful retreat from city hustle. Its palace, now a luxury hotel, stands as a testament to the region's royal heritage.How to Reach from Shimla: Chail is around 45 km from Shimla. The drive typically takes about 1.5 to 2 hours by car or taxi via the Kandaghat-Chail-Kufri Road, offering scenic views of the lush green valleys along the route. Distance from Shimla: 41 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Chail Attractions View Packages Read More 8. Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Dalai Lama Temple St. John in the Wilderness Church Dharamshala Cricket Stadium Dharamshala, nestled in the Kangra Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is globally renowned as the home of the Dalai Lama and for its vibrant Tibetan culture. The town, set against the backdrop of the majestic Dhauladhar mountain range, offers a mix of natural beauty and spiritual tranquility.How to Reach from Shimla: Dharamshala is approximately 240 km from Shimla. By road, the journey can take around 6-7 hours via the NH205 and NH503. Buses and taxis are available for the commute, offering travelers picturesque views of the hilly terrain. Distance from Shimla: 235 km Best Time: October to June 40 Dharamsala Attractions View Packages Read More 9. Jibhi, Himachal Pradesh Jibhi, nestled in the Tirthan Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is a quaint hamlet known for its picturesque landscapes, charming wooden homes, and gushing waterfalls. This lesser-explored gem offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of city life.How to Reach from Shimla: Jibhi is approximately 150 km away from Shimla. The most convenient way to reach Jibhi from Shimla is by road, a journey of around 5-6 hours, either by taking a taxi or by driving down the NH205 and NH154, passing through Mandi and then diverting towards Banjar. Distance from Shimla: 161 km Read More 10. Naldehra, Himachal Pradesh Naldehra, located in Himachal Pradesh, is a serene hill station renowned for its 9-hole golf course and lush greenery. Its meandering paths, towering deodar trees, and panoramic views make it a perfect retreat for nature lovers.How to Reach from Shimla: Naldehra is situated about 23 km away from Shimla. The most straightforward way to reach Naldehra is by road, which is roughly a 45-minute to an hour's drive, either by taxi or self-drive along the Shimla-Tattapani-Mandi road. Distance from Shimla: 23 km Read More 11. Mashobra, Himachal Pradesh - The quiet hill station near Shimla 4.7 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Reserve Forest Sanctuary Carignano Nature Park WildFlower Hall Hotel Mashobra is a tranquil hill station in Himachal Pradesh, known for its dense forests of pine, oak, and cedar, as well as its myriad orchards. The town, part of the Shimla Water Catchment Wildlife Sanctuary, offers an abundance of bird-watching opportunities and nature trails.How to Reach from Shimla: Mashobra is just about 13 km away from Shimla. The most convenient way to get there is by road, a journey of approximately 30 minutes by taxi or self-drive on the historic Hindustan-Tibet Road. Distance from Shimla: 10 km Best Time: April to June 11 Mashobra Attractions View Packages Read More 12. Solan, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 49+ photos Known For : Kasauli Nalagarh Fort Kuthar Fort Solan, often termed the 'Mushroom City of India', is a bustling town in Himachal Pradesh known for its mushroom farms and the prominent Mohan Meakin Brewery. Nestled between Shimla and Kalka, it is a haven for horticulture enthusiasts and offers a serene ambiance with its ancient temples and verdant surroundings.How to Reach from Shimla: Solan is around 45 km from Shimla. It can be reached in approximately 1.5 to 2 hours by road, either via taxi or bus, following the Shimla-Kalka Highway. Distance from Shimla: 45 km Best Time: Throughout the year 17 Solan Attractions Read More 13. Palampur, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Toy Train Saurabh Van Vihar Neugal Khad Palampur, set in Himachal Pradesh, is a serene hill station adorned with lush tea gardens and a backdrop of the snow-clad Dhauladhar mountain range. It is famed for its picturesque landscapes, pleasant climate, and rich cultural heritage.How to Reach from Shimla: Palampur is about 260 km from Shimla. The journey can be made by road, taking approximately 7-8 hours via the NH154 and NH205 routes. Regular buses and taxis are available from Shimla to Palampur. Kangra, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Kangra Fort Masrur Shaktipeeth Shri Brijeshwari Devi Temple Kangra, nestled in Himachal Pradesh, boasts of ancient temples, majestic forts, and a rich tapestry of history and culture. Set against the backdrop of the Dhauladhar range, it's a haven for history enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.How to Reach from Shimla: Kangra is around 220 km from Shimla. The journey by road takes approximately 6-7 hours via the NH154. Regular buses ply between Shimla and Kangra, or one can hire a taxi for a more comfortable journey. Distance from Shimla: 216 km Best Time: September to June 22 Kangra Attractions Read More 15. Barog, Himachal Pradesh Barog, a quaint hill station in Himachal Pradesh, is renowned for its lush green landscapes, British-era architecture, and the mysterious Barog Tunnel. Its serene ambiance and scenic beauty offer a peaceful retreat from city life.How to Reach from Shimla: Barog is approximately 60 km from Shimla. The journey by road takes about 2 hours via the NH5. One can either take a bus or hire a taxi from Shimla to reach Barog. Distance from Shimla: 54 km Read More 16. Sarahan, Kinnaur - Stunning hill station near Shimla 4.2 /5 View 15+ photos Sarahan, nestled in Himachal Pradesh, captivates visitors with its picturesque beauty and the striking Bhimakali Temple, a testament to Indo-Tibetan architecture. Overlooking the snow-clad Himalayas, this village offers an idyllic retreat amidst nature.How to Reach from Shimla: Sarahan is approximately 170 km from Shimla. The journey by road takes around 6-7 hours, traversing through NH5 and NH505. Regular buses and taxis are available from Shimla for a comfortable journey to Sarahan. Parwanoo, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Timber Trail Cable car Ride Fruit orchards Parwanoo, situated in the Solan district of Himachal Pradesh, is renowned as a bustling industrial town that seamlessly blends with its verdant orchards, especially apple orchards, and scenic beauty. It's also the gateway to the popular tourist destinations in the state, making it a significant pit-stop for travelers.How to Reach from Shimla: Parwanoo is around 70 km from Shimla. The drive, predominantly on NH5, takes about 2-3 hours. Regular buses and taxis ply between Shimla and Parwanoo, offering convenient options for travelers. Distance from Shimla: 84 km Best Time: March to May, October to November 10 Parwanoo Attractions Read More 18. Chindi, Himachal Pradesh 3.1 /5 Chindi, set amidst the tranquil settings of Himachal Pradesh, offers a picturesque landscape with dense forests and verdant apple orchards, making it a perfect retreat for nature lovers. The area is dotted with ancient temples, adding a touch of spirituality to its serene ambiance.How to Reach from Shimla: Chindi is approximately 90 km away from Shimla. The journey can be made by road, taking about 3-4 hours via the NH5 and the Karsog-Chindi Road. Regular taxis or self-drive are the preferred options for reaching Chindi from Shimla. Narkanda, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Skiing in Narkanda Hatu Peak Hatu Mata Temple Narkanda, nestled amidst the Shivalik Range, offers a unique blend of lush greenery and snow-capped peaks, making it a sought-after skiing destination in winters. The place is also renowned for its apple orchards and the ancient Hatu Temple that offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys.How to Reach from Shimla: Narkanda is around 65 km from Shimla. It's an approximate 2-hour drive via the NH5. Regular buses ply between Shimla and Narkanda, or one can opt for taxis available in Shimla for a more comfortable journey. Distance from Shimla: 60 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Narkanda Attractions View Packages Read More 20. Churdhar, Himachal Pradesh 3.1 /5 Churdhar, the highest peak in the outer Himalayas, is revered for the temple dedicated to Lord Shiva at its summit and offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and snow-clad peaks. Trekkers flock to this region, drawn by its pristine beauty and the challenge of the ascent.How to Reach from Shimla: Churdhar is approximately 115 km from Shimla. The most common route is via Solan to Rajgarh and then Haripurdhar, from where the trek starts. It's roughly a 4-5 hour drive to the trek's starting point, and from there, one can embark on the trek to the Churdhar peak. Distance from Shimla: 113 km Read More 21. Sirmour, Himachal Pradesh Sirmour, also known as the "Peach Bowl of India", is one of Himachal Pradesh's lesser-known treasures, offering lush green landscapes, quaint villages, and serene lakes. Nestled in the south-eastern part of the state, its rich cultural heritage and historical sites make it an intriguing destination for travelers.How to Reach from Shimla: Sirmour is roughly 150 km away from Shimla. One can reach Sirmour by road, with a drive time of around 4-5 hours. The journey usually involves taking the NH707, passing through Solan, which offers scenic views and a delightful travel experience. Distance from Shimla: 152 km Read More 22. Kalpa, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 25+ photos Known For : Kalpa Monastery Trekking to Chaka Suicide Point Kalpa, located in the Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh, offers breathtaking views of the Kinner Kailash mountain range and is known for its apple orchards, ancient temples, and monasteries. The quaint village's serene environment and rich cultural heritage make it a sought-after destination for those seeking tranquility.How to Reach from Shimla: Kalpa is approximately 230 km from Shimla. The best way to reach Kalpa from Shimla is by road, taking the NH-5 route, which typically takes around 7-8 hours. The journey offers scenic mountain views and passes through picturesque landscapes. Distance from Shimla: 232 km Best Time: March to June; October - November 10 Kalpa Attractions View Packages Read More 23. Tirthan Valley, Himachal Pradesh 4.4 /5 View 7+ photos Known For : Great Himalayan National Park Serlosar Lake Jibhi Tirthan Valley, set in the Kullu district of Himachal Pradesh, is a hidden gem renowned for its pristine beauty, river adventures, and as the gateway to the Great Himalayan National Park. Its untouched landscapes, coupled with opportunities for trout fishing and trekking, make it a haven for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts.How to Reach from Shimla: Tirthan Valley is approximately 150 km from Shimla. One can reach the valley by taking a car or taxi via NH205 and NH3, which generally takes around 4-5 hours. The drive, meandering through hilly terrains, offers panoramic views of the surrounding mountains. Best Time: Mar to June, October to November 11 Tirthan Valley Attractions View Packages Read More 24. Kanatal, Uttarakhand 4.0 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : New Tehri Dhanaulti Camping Kanatal, nestled in the state of Uttarakhand, offers a picturesque escape with its majestic hills, dense forests, and serene environment. It's an ideal destination for those looking to experience tranquility away from the hustle of city life.How to Reach from Shimla: Kanatal is approximately 340 km away from Shimla. The most convenient way to travel is by road, which takes around 9-10 hours via NH507. Travelers can hire a taxi or self-drive, passing through beautiful mountainous routes to reach the destination. Distance from Shimla: 307 km Best Time: Throughout the year 10 Kanatal Attractions Read More 25. Barot, Himachal Pradesh 3.6 /5 Barot, in Himachal Pradesh, is a hidden gem known for its lush landscapes, terraced fields, and the pristine Uhl river. It offers an idyllic setting for nature lovers and is famous for its trout fishing and a reservoir of the Jogindernagar Hydel Power Project.How to Reach from Shimla: Barot is around 180 km from Shimla. The most practical way to reach Barot from Shimla is by road, which takes approximately 6-7 hours. One can opt for taxis or self-drive; the journey is scenic, especially as you pass through Mandi and Jogindernagar. Distance from Shimla: 205 km Read More 26. Chitkul, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 Chitkul, situated in the Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh, is the last inhabited village near the Indo-Tibetan border, boasting of unspoiled beauty and snow-capped mountains. Often referred to as the "crown of Kinnaur", it offers breathtaking views and is the starting point for several treks.How to Reach from Shimla: Chitkul is approximately 240 km away from Shimla. The most convenient way to reach is by road, which takes around 7-8 hours. One can hire a taxi or take a bus towards Sangla, and from there, it's a short journey to Chitkul. Distance from Shimla: 244 km Read More 27. Malana, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 Malana, nestled in the Parvati Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is a unique village often referred to as the "ancient isolated Indian village". Known for its distinct culture and the famed Malana Cream (a strain of Cannabis), the village is surrounded by towering peaks and dense forests.How to Reach from Shimla: Malana is roughly 250 km from Shimla. The most direct route is by road, which takes approximately 7-8 hours. Travelers can hire a taxi or take a bus up to Jari, and from there, it's a trek or local transport to reach Malana village. Distance from Shimla: 236 km Read More 28. Hampta Pass, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 Hampta Pass is a picturesque corridor in the Himalayas located between the Kullu Valley and the Lahaul Valley, renowned for its unique landscapes and an exciting trek that transitions from lush greenery to arid desolation. The trek offers a diverse range of sceneries, from pine forests to open meadows and river crossings.How to Reach from Shimla: Hampta Pass trek starts from a village called Jobra, approximately 290 km from Shimla. The best way to reach Jobra is to take a taxi or bus from Shimla to Manali and then proceed to Jobra. The entire journey can take around 8-10 hours depending on the mode of transport and road conditions. Distance from Shimla: 248 km Read More 29. Sangla, Himachal Pradesh 4.4 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Chitkul Rakchham Batseri Village Sangla, set in the Baspa Valley and often dubbed as one of the most beautiful valleys in India, captivates travelers with its stunning landscapes, apple orchards, and ancient temples. The valley, especially the Sangla village, serves as a serene retreat and a base to explore nearby attractions like Chitkul.How to Reach from Shimla: Sangla is approximately 230 km from Shimla. The most convenient way to get there is by road, and the journey can take around 6-7 hours by car or taxi, passing through picturesque Himalayan routes and terrains. Distance from Shimla: 221 km Best Time: April to June, September - October 10 Sangla Attractions View Packages Read More 30. Manali, Himachal Pradesh 4.8 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Solang Valley Hadimba Devi Temple Manali Mall Road Manali, cradled in the lap of the Himachal Pradesh mountains, is renowned for its enchanting landscapes, bubbling rivers, and a plethora of adventure activities. Often termed the 'Valley of the Gods', this bustling hill station also acts as a gateway to the majestic Rohtang Pass and the ancient Spiti Valley.How to Reach from Shimla: Manali is roughly 250 km from Shimla. Travelers can undertake a scenic drive of about 7-8 hours by car or bus through the winding mountain roads, with several breathtaking viewpoints along the way. Distance from Shimla: 246 km Best Time: October to June 53 Manali Attractions View Packages Read More 31. Kullu, Himachal Pradesh 4.4 /5 View 23+ photos Known For : Great Himalayan National Park Rafting in Kullu Manali Bijlimahadev temple Kullu, nestled in the heart of the Himalayas, is famed for its verdant valleys, ancient temples, and vibrant Dussehra festival. The valley town, often dubbed the "Valley of Gods," serves as a base for various treks and adventure activities.How to Reach from Shimla: Kullu is located approximately 230 km from Shimla. The most convenient way to reach Kullu from Shimla is by road, which takes around 6-7 hours by car or bus, journeying through picturesque mountain terrains. Distance from Shimla: 207 km Best Time: March to June 29 Kullu Attractions View Packages Read More 32. Kinnaur Kailash, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 5+ photos Kinnaur Kailash, located in the Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh, is a sacred mountain for Hindus, believed to be the abode of Lord Shiva. Its majestic beauty, snow-capped peaks, and challenging treks make it a favorite among both pilgrims and adventure enthusiasts.How to Reach from Shimla: Kinnaur Kailash is approximately 235 km from Shimla. The most convenient way to reach is by road, taking the NH5 route, which takes around 7-8 hours by car or bus through the scenic landscapes of Himachal Pradesh. Distance from Shimla: 223 km Read More 33. Tosh, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 12+ photos Tosh, nestled in the picturesque Parvati Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is known for its breathtaking landscapes, lush greenery, and serene ambiance. It serves as a perfect destination for trekkers and those seeking a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle.How to Reach from Shimla: Tosh is roughly 250 km from Shimla. The most advisable route is to first reach Bhuntar by road (around 6-7 hours drive), and from there, drive to Barshaini followed by a short trek or taxi ride to Tosh, making the total journey approximately 9-10 hours. Distance from Shimla: 228 km Read More 34. Kangojodi, Himachal Pradesh Kangojodi, located in Himachal Pradesh, is a lesser-known gem surrounded by dense pine forests, offering an offbeat escape for nature and adventure enthusiasts. Its tranquil setting and pristine environment make it an ideal spot for trekking, bird-watching, and camping.How to Reach from Shimla: Kangojodi is approximately 275 km away from Shimla. The most direct route involves driving via NH205 and NH7, which takes around 6-7 hours. Regular bus services are also available from Shimla to the nearby town of Nahan, from where one can hire a taxi to reach Kangojodi. Distance from Shimla: 107 km Read More 35. Kiarighat, Himachal Pradesh Kiarighat, nestled in Himachal Pradesh, offers a serene hillside retreat with its scenic vistas and lush green surroundings. This quaint stopover is known for its apple orchards and as a quiet break-point for travelers on the Shimla-Chandigarh highway.How to Reach from Shimla: Kiarighat is located just about 30 km from Shimla. The easiest way to get there is by car or taxi, taking the NH5 route, which is roughly an hour's drive. Buses plying towards Chandigarh from Shimla also pass through Kiarighat.
